comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Author/Editor of "The Ethics of Confucius." A review of the book on Amazon contains this author's note:

"MILES MENANDER DAWSON (1863-1942) was deeply interested in poetry and philosophy, particularly ethics, and wrote books about the teachings of Zoroaster, Socrates, as well as Confucius. Born in Wisconsin, Dawson spent his life as a highly respected actuary in New York. He wrote numerous books on life insurance and actuarial science and was a member of the Confucian Society of China."

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Excellent detective work. I added him to Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miles_Menander_Dawson
